faqContent.question: What is the difference between an LOA and a RespOrg?
faqContent.answer: The LOA (Letter Of Authorization) is used when porting regular telephone numbers. The RespOrg (Responsible Organization) is used when porting Toll-free numbers.

faqContent.question: How long will my port take?
faqContent.answer: This cannot be determined until the port request is submitted. We have seen port requests scheduled within 3 to 4 days from the submittal date, but have come across some that take several weeks to a month before a scheduled date is granted, due to rejections.

faqContent.question: I looked at the current bill copy and noticed the numbers I am requesting to port are not listed. Can I still submit the request using this bill copy?
faqContent.answer: Yes, you are more than welcome to submit using the bill copy as long as you know all numbers that are associated with the bill/account.

faqContent.question: Will I be notified of a scheduled port date so I can ensure my client's account is set up?
faqContent.answer: Yes, we will notify you of the scheduled port date at least a day or two prior to the scheduled date. We will also notify you once the port completes.

faqContent.question: Can I set up call routing prior to the scheduled port date?
faqContent.answer: Yes, and we recommend this for a smooth transition.

faqContent.question: My client has international numbers. Can I port international numbers?
faqContent.answer: At this time, we can only port some Canadian numbers. This may vary depending upon if your provider has coverage in the region of the number(s).

faqContent.question: How quickly will I know if my port request has been rejected?
faqContent.answer: You will be notified, by our Porting Department, that a request has been rejected within that day or the subsequent day we receive the notice.

faqContent.question: How do I cancel a port in progress?
faqContent.answer: If you decide to cancel a port, update the note section in the Porting Manager App of Smart PBX

faqContent.question: What is the port-out process (from your provider to a new provider)?
faqContent.answer: To port out a number, submit the request to the gaining provider. If you receive a rejection notification from the gaining carrier for an additional document, please contact Support and we will try to help. Once you receive a port date from the gaining provider, you are responsible for deleting the number from the Account.

faqContent.question: What is a bulk port?
faqContent.answer: We consider a bulk port to be 100+ numbers.

faqContent.question: Is there a discount available for bulk ports?
faqContent.answer: Bulk ports are considered over 100 numbers. For inquiries about discounts, please contact your Account Manager.

faqContent.question: Do I have to submit a bulk port through the UI?
faqContent.answer: No, submit bulk ports to Support and our Porting Department will handle them for you. When submitting a Support Ticket ensure to include the LOA (Letter Of Authorization?  and a current bill pay.
